title: Types of semantic mechanism of humor found in Hannah Montana serial drama
abstract: In this research the writer is interested in the types of semantic mechanisms that used in Hannah Montana serial drama. Secondly, the writer also wanted to know which type will use the most frequently. The data of this study were gathered from the Hannah Montana serial drama transcript from seasons 2 and 3. There are 22 jokes that the writer observed. These jokes were analyzed by using semantic mechanisms, which consisted of lexical ambiguity, grammatical ambiguity, and truth conditional semantic also causal fallacy. This study was a quantitative descriptive approach. The writer gathered and analyzed the data to answer her curiosity. In achieving her purposed, the writer divided her analysis into 2 parts. The first one was the writer analyzed all of the data to find out what manipulation or what kind of semantic mechanism used in this serial drama. The second step showed how the results of the first analysis were put into a table to show which types of the semantic mechanism used the most. Then the writer found that the semantic mechanism used in this thesis were lexical ambiguity, truth conditional semantic, and the causal fallacy. Also, the most semantic mechanism was lexical ambiguity.
